item.title: Daanon add a quote by e.e. cummings
item.description: "To be nobody but yourself in a world which is doing its best day and night to make you like everybody else means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight and never stop fighting." -- e.e. cummings

item.title: Daanon add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "We do not believe in ourselves until someone reveals that deep inside us something is valuable, worth listening to, worthy of our trust, sacred to our touch. Once we believe in ourselves we can risk curiosity, wonder, spontaneous delight or any experience that reveals the human spirit." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Daanon add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "when man determined to destroy himself he picked the was of shall and finding only why smashed it into because." -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Daanon add a quote by E.E. Cummings
item.description: "since the thing perhaps is to eat flowers and not to be afraid" -- E.E. Cummings

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Paul Wellstone
item.description: "Never separate the life you lead from the words you speak." -- Paul Wellstone

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I went to the woods because I wished to live deliberately, to front only the essential facts of life, and see if I could not learn what it had to teach, and not, when I came to die, discover that I had not lived. I did not wish to live what was not life, living is so dear; nor did I wish to practise resignation, unless it was quite necessary. I wanted to live deep and suck out all the marrow of life, to live so sturdily and Spartan-like as to put to rout all that was not life, to cut a broad swath and shave close, to drive life into a corner, and reduce it to its lowest terms." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Our truest life is when we are in dreams awake." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Most men lead lives of quiet desperation and go to the grave with the song still in them." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Do not be too moral. You may cheat yourself out of much life so. Aim above morality. Be not simply good, be good for something." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "It's not what you look at that matters, it's what you see." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Any fool can make a rule And any fool will mind it." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "I learned this, at least, by my experiment: that if one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams, and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined, he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Unless someone like you cares a whole awful lot, Nothing is going to get better. It's not." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Our lives begin to end the day we become silent about things that matter." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "The ultimate measure of a man is not where he stands in moments of comfort and convenience, but where he stands at times of challenge and controversy." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Nothing in the world is more dangerous than sincere ignorance and conscientious stupidity." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description:
"On some positions, cowardice asks the question, is it expedient? And then expedience comes along and asks the question, is it politic? Vanity asks the question, is it popular? Conscience asks the question, is it right?
There comes a time when one must take the position that is neither safe nor politic nor popular, but he must do it because conscience tells him it is right." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Intelligence plus character-that is the goal of true education." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "And remember, no matter where you go, there you are." -- Confucius

item.title: Daanon add a quote by PJ Haarsma
item.description: "Fear Nothing" OIO Key" -- PJ Haarsma

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Laini Taylor
item.description: "Stars got tangled in her hair whenever she played in the sky." -- Laini Taylor

item.title: Daanon add a quote by David Lynch
item.description: "There's always fear of the unknown where there's mystery" -- David Lynch

item.title: Daanon add a quote by Tim Burton
item.description: "I am the shadow on the moon at night/Filling your dreams to the brim with fright." -- Tim Burton

item.title: Daanon add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life is pain, highness. Anyone who says differently is selling something." -- William Goldman

item.title: Daanon add a quote by William Goldman
item.description: "Life isn't fair, it's just fairer than death, that's all." -- William Goldman
